programme.title: Scooby-Doo
programme.sub-title: Action, Comedy, Family, Drama, Fantasy, Mystery, Children's ║ 2002 ║ PG
programme.desc: Comedy adventure based on the Hanna-Barbera cartoon, starring Matthew Lillard, Freddie Prinze Jr, Sarah Michelle Gellar and Linda Cardellini. Two years after a clash of egos caused the disbanding of Mystery Inc, Scooby-Doo and his teen pals are summoned to Spooky Island holiday resort to investigate a series of paranormal incidents. programme.title: Scooby-Doo 2: Monsters Unleashed
programme.sub-title: Action, Comedy, Family, Drama, Fantasy, Horror, Mystery, Sci Fi ║ 2004 ║ PG
programme.desc: Mystery comedy adventure sequel based on the Hanna-Barbera cartoon, starring Matthew Lillard, Freddie Prinze Jr, Sarah Michelle Gellar and Linda Cardellini. When a masked villain wrecks the newly launched Coolsonian Criminology Museum, the Mystery Inc team lose their unblemished reputation. programme.title: The Lego Batman Movie
programme.sub-title: Comedy, Drama, Animation, Action, Family, Fantasy, Sci Fi, Children's ║ 2017 ║ U
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voice of Will Arnett. programme.title: No Country for Old Men
programme.desc: Oscar-winning crime thriller from the Coen brothers, starring Tommy Lee Jones, Javier Bardem and Josh Brolin. programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
programme.sub-title: Action, Fantasy, Drama, Sci Fi ║ 2001 ║ PG
programme.desc: Epic fantasy adventure based on the first part of JRR Tolkien's classic trilogy, directed by Peter Jackson, and starring Elijah Wood and Ian McKellen. Frodo, a mild-mannered hobbit, inherits a ring that gives the wearer absolute power. programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
programme.desc: The second part of Peter Jackson's epic adaptation of JRR Tolkien's classic fantasy adventure, starring Elijah Wood and Ian McKellen. programme.title: 8 Mile
programme.desc: Drama starring rap artist Eminem and Kim Basinger. Jimmy "Rabbit" Smith is stuck in a dead-end factory job in a tough area of Detroit where he lives with his highly strung mother and little sister. Jimmy longs to break out of this bleak existence by making it as a rapper, but his road to stardom is going to be a rocky one Curtis Hanson - Director, Curtis Hanson - Director Marshall Mathers - Jimmy \Rabbit\ Smith Kim Basinger - Stephanie Brittany Murphy - Alex Mekhi Phifer - Future Evan Jones - Cheddar Bob Omar Benson Miller - Sol George Eugene Byrd - Wink De'Angelo Wilson - DJ Iz Marshall Mathers - Jimmy \Rabbit\ Smith Kim Basinger - Stephanie Brittany Murphy - Alex Mekhi Phifer - Future Evan Jones - Cheddar Bob Omar Benson Miller - Sol George Eugene Byrd - Wink De'Angelo Wilson - DJ Iz.

programme.title: Batman Begins
programme.desc: Action fantasy starring Christian Bale. When the wealthy parents of young Bruce Wayne are killed in front of him during a street robbery, the traumatised youth becomes bitter and eaten up with a desire for revenge. After a period in the Far East where he learns disciplined fighting skills and the power to channel his rage from the enigmatic Henri Ducard, the now adult Wayne returns to a Gotham City riddled with corruption and embarks on a crusade to cleanse the metropolis of crime under the guise of "the Batman" Christopher Nolan - Director, Christopher Nolan - Director Christian Bale - Bruce Wayne / Batman Michael Caine - Alfred the butler Liam Neeson - Henri Ducard Katie Holmes - Rachel Dawes Gary Oldman - Detective Sergeant James Gordon Cillian Murphy - Dr Jonathan Crane / Scarecrow Tom Wilkinson - Carmine Falcone Rutger Hauer - Richard Earle Ken Watanabe - Ra's al Ghul Morgan Freeman - Lucius Fox Colin McFarlane - Commissioner Loeb Alexandra Bastedo - Mrs Delane Linus Roache - Dr Thomas Wayne Mark Boone Junior - Flass Sara Stewart - Martha Wayne Richard Brake - Joe Chill Christian Bale - Bruce Wayne / Batman Michael Caine - Alfred the butler Liam Neeson - Henri Ducard Katie Holmes - Rachel Dawes Gary Oldman - Detective Sergeant James Gordon Cillian Murphy - Dr Jonathan Crane / Scarecrow Tom Wilkinson - Carmine Falcone Rutger Hauer - Richard Earle Ken Watanabe - Ra's al Ghul Morgan Freeman - Lucius Fox Colin McFarlane - Commissioner Loeb Alexandra Bastedo - Mrs Delane Linus Roache - Dr Thomas Wayne Mark Boone Junior - Flass Sara Stewart - Martha Wayne Richard Brake - Joe Chill.

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.sub-title: Mystery, Drama, Crime/detective, Sci Fi, Action, Thriller ║ 2002 ║ 12
programme.desc: Futuristic action thriller from director Steven Spielberg, based on the Philip K Dick short story, starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell and Samantha Morton. In the mid-21st century, John Anderton is in charge of the Justice Department's Precrime unit, an elite force that can predict offences and make arrests before the crimes are committed. programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biographical drama starring Julia Roberts. programme.title: Book of Love
programme.desc: Young, uptight and unsuccessful English writer Henry's latest novel sells poorly. programme.title: Gunpowder Milkshake
programme.desc: In her turbulent life as a professional assassin, Scarlet was cruelly forced to abandon her daughter Sam and go on the run. Years later, despite the estrangement, Sam has also grown up into a cold-blooded hitwoman. After a high-stakes mission spins out of control, Sam has no choice but to go rogue. This ultimately leads her back to her mother and her former sidekicks, who join forces against those who took everything from them. programme.title: The Cinema List: Sky Original Thrillers
programme.desc: Love a thriller, but unsure what you want to watch next? Then join us for this fast-paced rundown of the best Sky Original thrillers, from The Desperate Hour to The Independent and beyond.

programme.title: To Catch a Killer
programme.desc: Eleanor is a talented but troubled young rookie detective wrestling with the demons of her past, when she is called to the scene of a brutal mass shooting - the work of a new and terrifying murderer. The police and FBI launch a nationwide manhunt, but are thwarted at every turn by the killer's enigmatic, and unprecedented behaviour. Despite her lack of experience, Eleanor is drawn deeper into the case as she, and her newfound mentor, realise that she may be the only person, given her own tortured psyche, who can understand the mind of this singular killer. programme.title: To Catch a Killer
programme.desc: Eleanor is a talented but troubled young rookie detective wrestling with the demons of her past, when she is called to the scene of a brutal mass shooting - the work of a new and terrifying murderer. The police and FBI launch a nationwide manhunt, but are thwarted at every turn by the killer's enigmatic, and unprecedented behaviour. programme.title: Please Don't Destroy: The Treasure of Foggy Mountain
programme.desc: Directionless twenty something Ben Patterson lives with pals John and Martin. All three work at the Trout Plus outdoor goods emporium run by Ben's overbearing father, Farley. Ben resolves to earn his father's respect by unearthing the booty. programme.title: Please Don't Destroy: The Treasure of Foggy Mountain
programme.desc: Directionless twenty something Ben Patterson lives with pals John and Martin. All three work at the Trout Plus outdoor goods emporium run by Ben's overbearing father, Farley. A random social media post intimates that an old compass, which Ben, John and Martin found as children, could be the missing link to discovering a bust of Marie Antoinette worth an estimated 100million US dollars. Ben resolves to earn his father's respect by unearthing the booty. programme.title: Please Don't Destroy: The Treasure of Foggy Mountain
programme.desc: Directionless twenty something Ben Patterson lives with pals John and Martin. All three work at the Trout Plus outdoor goods emporium run by Ben's overbearing father, Farley. A random social media post intimates that an old compass, which Ben, John and Martin found as children, could be the missing link to discovering a bust of Marie Antoinette worth an estimated 100million US dollars. Ben resolves to earn his father's respect by unearthing the booty. programme.title: Please Don't Destroy: The Treasure of Foggy Mountain
programme.desc: Directionless twenty something Ben Patterson lives with pals John and Martin. All three work at the Trout Plus outdoor goods emporium run by Ben's overbearing father, Farley. programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: In 2006 an unseeded 18-year-old Andy Murray defeated Australian Grand Slam champion Lleyton Hewitt in San Jose to win the first of his 46 ATP Tour titles.

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: In his second year as a professional player, 19-year-old Andy Murray made his top-10 debut after an impressive run at Indian Wells in 2007, beating Tommy Haas in an epic quarter-final.

programme.title: Andy Murray: Grit, Glory & Legacy
programme.desc: Reflections on Sir Andy Murray's career - his determination, greatest achievements and the legacy he leaves - from stars including Navratilova, Henman, Draper, Raducanu and more.

programme.title: Murray vs The Big Three
programme.desc: As Andy Murray's retirement nears, relive some of his best matches against tennis' Big Three. Featuring highlights from wins over Nadal in Madrid, Federer in Shanghai and Djokovic in Rome.

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: Defeating career-rival Novak Djokovic for the second tournament in a row, revisit the moment Andy Murray won his first ATP Masters 1000 event at Cincinnati in 2008.

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: Within striking distance of a first Grand Slam final, it would take a four-set battle for Andy Murray to achieve his dream as the young Scot overcame Rafael Nadal at the 2008 US Open.

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: Aiming to emulate Andre Agassi in becoming the first player to defend the Toronto crown since 1995, Andy Murray would have to find a way past Roger Federer in a final for the first time.

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: An extended look at Andy Murray's victory at the 2012 US Open. The Scot beat Novak Djokovic to become the first British man since Fred Perry in 1936 to win a Grand Slam singles title.

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: Ranked number three in the world at the time, Andy Murray eyed his first clay-court title as the 27-year-old Scot fought Bavaria's own Philipp Kohlschreiber in the 2015 Munich final.

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: With a second Wimbledon title and Olympic gold in Rio in the bank, Andy Murray capped 2016 by capturing world-number-one status after beating Novak Djokovic at the ATP World Tour Finals.

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: 961 days and one new hip later, Andy Murray accomplished an incredible feat nine months after career-saving surgery by beating Stan Wawrinka in Antwerp to end a two-year wait for a title.

programme.title: Murray's Moments
programme.desc: At the 2023 US Open, 2012 champion Andy Murray fought his way to a 200th Grand Slam win by overcoming the flamboyant Frenchman Corentin Moutet in an entertaining straight-set victory.

programme.desc: Remember a classic match from the Premier League. Here, Chelsea and Arsenal go head-to-head in an eight-goal thriller at Stamford Bridge back in 2011.

programme.desc: Revisit an incredible match at the 2014 World Grand Prix of Darts, as James Wade and Robert Thornton both hit nine-darters during their round two meeting. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Bristow v Taylor: WDC SF 1997
programme.desc: Revisit a semi-final from the 1997 World Darts Championship that pitted Eric Bristow, who was enjoying one of his greatest runs in the PDC, up against Phil Taylor. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: MVG v Wade: Premier Lge 2015
programme.desc: Revisit a classic Premier League Darts contest from the Motorpoint Arena where Michael Van Gerwen dismantled James Wade in 2015 with an average of 116.90. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Taylor v Mason 2002
programme.desc: In a match that saw the first-ever televised nine-darter, revisit this classic contest between Phil Taylor and Chris Mason at the 2002 World Matchplay. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: LIVE: European Open Pool Final
programme.desc: At the 2024 European Open Pool Championship in Fulda, Germany, a champion is crowned as the competition comes to an end. Last year, David Alcaide defeated Anton Raga in the final. (11.08).

programme.title: S/Lge: Huddersfield v Leeds Hlts
programme.desc: Huddersfield Giants take on Leeds Rhinos in the Betfred Super League. Luke Robinson guided his Giants team to victory for the first time as interim coach, overcoming Salford 16-8. (25.07).

programme.title: S/Lge: Wigan v Warrington Hlts
programme.desc: Wigan Warriors host Warrington Wolves in the Betfred Super League. The leaders and reigning champions Wigan were stunned by Hull FC in round 18, losing at the MKM Stadium. (26.07).

programme.title: S/Lge: Wigan v Huddersfield Hlts
programme.desc: Wigan Warriors host Huddersfield Giants in the Betfred Super League. For the first time since June 2023, the reigning champions Wigan have endured back-to-back defeats. (01.08).

programme.title: S/Lge: Warrington v Hull KR Hlts
programme.desc: The new league leaders Warrington Wolves host Hull KR in the Betfred Super League. Sam Burgess' Wolves emerged victorious in last week's colossal clash, defeating rivals Wigan. (02.08).

programme.title: Best of NFL
programme.desc: The New York Giants battle the Seattle Seahawks at MetLife Stadium in week four of the NFL. With a 1-2 record, the Giants are out to stop their run of slow first-half starts. (02.10).

programme.desc: As the 2024 NFL season fast approaches, take an all-access look at the Chicago Bears' pre-season training camp as they prepare for another gruelling campaign on the gridiron. Ep 1.

programme.title: ATP Final: Umag

programme.desc: A review of the 2004/05 season. Jose Mourinho ended Chelsea's 50-year wait for a top-flight title, while Man Utd made Wayne Rooney the most expensive teenager in British football.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2005/06
programme.desc: A review of the 2005/06 season. Jose Mourinho continued his success with Chelsea, Alan Shearer broke Newcastle's scoring record and Harry Redknapp rescued Portsmouth from the drop.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2006/07
programme.desc: A review of the 2006/07 season. Ashley Cole began life at Chelsea, Arsene Wenger celebrated his 10th year in charge and West Ham snapped up Carlos Tevez and Javier Mascherano.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2007/08
programme.desc: A review of the 2007/08 season. Jose Mourinho's first tenure as Chelsea manager ended, Cristiano Ronaldo topped the scoring charts and Fulham dramatically escaped relegation.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2008/09
programme.desc: A review of the 2008/09 season. Manchester City began a new era under new ownership, Manchester United secured a third successive title and Newcastle were dramatically relegated.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2009/10
programme.desc: A review of the 2009/10 season. Top scorer Didier Drogba fired Chelsea to the title, Manchester City spent big and Spurs secured Champions League qualification for the first time.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2010/11
programme.desc: A review of the 2010/11 season. Man Utd surpassed Liverpool's record of 18 top-flight titles, Man City secured the signing of Yaya Toure and Wolves dramatically avoided relegation.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2011/12
programme.desc: A review of the 2011/12 season. As the competition entered its 20th year, Man City won their first title in dramatic fashion and Wigan produced a great escape to avoid the drop.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2012/13
programme.desc: A review of the 2012/13 season. Sir Alex Ferguson ended his managerial career as Manchester United clinched their 13th Premier League title and FA Cup winners Wigan were relegated.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2013/14
programme.desc: A review of the 2013/14 season. Manchester City clinched their second Premier League title, Jose Mourinho returned to Chelsea and Tony Pulis masterminded a great escape at Palace.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2014/15
programme.desc: A review of the 2014/15 season. Eden Hazard's superb form helped Chelsea clinch their fifth title, while newly-promoted Burnley and QPR made immediate returns to the Championship.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2015/16
programme.desc: A review of the 2015/16 season. Leicester City shocked the footballing world, Jose Mourinho's second tenure at Chelsea came to an end and Newcastle dropped into the second tier.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2016/17
